bug.short_desc: [1.8][compiler] Support language model API for repeated annotations

long_desc.thetext: We must support the extension to the language model API - specifically javax.lang.model.AnnotatedConstruct.getAnnotationsByType(Class<A>) - in order to support annotation processing of repeated annotations.

Jesper, if it alright with you, I would like to take a crack at this tomorrow: Having just reviewed the work for javax.lang.model related changes for JSR308, I feel I can quickly wrap this up even while code generation work is progressing in parallel under your stewardship.
Basically I plan to proceed under the assumption that type bindings originating from source constructs will have repeated annotations and the ones from binaries will have container annotations and plan to create a virtual reality for annotation processors that would match the spec.
Which leads me to one question: When the container annotation is explicitly used in the code, how will AnnotatedConstruct.getAnnotationByType() know that it should not unwrap the contained annotations ? I don't know the answer, but will investigate.
I hope this proposal for me to grab this task is alright with you.

(In reply to comment #1) > Which leads me to one question: When the container annotation is explicitly > used in the code, how will AnnotatedConstruct.getAnnotationByType() know > that it should not unwrap the contained annotations ? I don't know the > answer, but will investigate.
javac could show the way, but my hunch is that is no way to tell. One way of fixing: Have both. Another: Always prefer repeated or container. I don't see a clear winner.
> I hope this proposal for me to grab this task is alright with you.
Yes, absolutely
